text: 10 Julai 2017- SERAMAI 23 pemilik kereta yang mendakwa menjadi mangsa penipuan syarikat pajakan kenderaan berkumpul di premis simpanan kereta Jalan Sungai Sekamat, Kajang bagi menuntut semula kereta mereka yang ditemui di lokasi berkenaan hari ini.Usaha bermula pada 11 pagi diketuai Pengarah Unit Tindakan Khas Persatuan Pengguna Islam Malaysia (PPIM)Yusuf Azmi yang membawa semua 23 mangsa ke sebuah pusat penyimpanan kenderaan yang menempatkan semua kereta mangsa sejak beberapa bulan lalu.Yusuf ketika ditemui berkata, pihaknya telah mendapatkan perkhidmatan trak tunda untuk membawa kereta terbabit bersama pemiliknya ke lokasi yang telah dipastikan atau balai polis berhampiran untuk tindakan selanjutkan."Bagaimanapun usaha kami sedikit kesukaran apabila pekerja syarikat trak tunda tiba-tiba enggan menunda kenderaan berkenaan walaupun pemiliknya ada bersama kerana mendakwa diugut pekerja syarikat pajakan terbabit."Keadaan itu membuatkan PPIM terpaksa menggunakan perkhidmatan trak tunda di luar kawasan ini dan sehingga kini jam 6 petang kami berjaya mengeluarkan sebuah Proton Exora mangsa sementara kira-kira 10 trak tunda lain dalam perjalanan ke lokasi untuk menarik baki 22 lagi kenderaan," katanya.Khamis lalu, Harian Metro melaporkan PPIM menerima lebih 500 aduan mengenai penipuan syarikat pajakan kenderaan didalangi lelaki bergelar Datuk Seri.Ketua aktivisnya Datuk Nadzim Johan dilaporkan berkata, modus operandi digunakan ialah sambung bayar menerusi satu perjanjian yang sebenarnya tidak membawa nilai apa-apa.Menurutnya, pemilik kenderaan dijanjikan bahawa kereta yang mereka pajak itu mempunyai penyewa dan mereka tidak akan mempunyai masalah pembiayaan dengan institusi kewangan.Bagaimanapun sebaliknya berlaku apabila pemilik kenderaaan akhirnya menerima notis dari bank memaklumkan terdapat tunggakan bayaran bulanan sehingga tujuh bulan.SOS

Pajak company agree to pay downpayment and monthly installment for 'investors'. however the bank loan is under the investor name. pajak company will try to rent out cars at a higher premium so that the investors can get their profit. example is like this.Saga BLM is RM40kpajak kereta will pay Rm4k DP and monthly installment of around RM300/month. the pajak kereta will then rent this car out at RM500 so that the investor can get a profit of rm200. however, the bank loan must be under the investors name.all is well if there is constant rental. however problem arises if there isn't.like in this case, the pajak kereta did not pay the monthly installments, so the investors name busuk in ctos/ccris and they use force to get back the cars. now the thing is, this isn't really fair for the pajak kereta who put the DP right?

They just robbed back their own property that is inside robber's private property. Kereta Pajak is an investment method, you give your IC and detail to Syarikat Sewa Kereta, then they use your detail to take a loan under your name to buy the car. They then use your car for sewa kerata business and promised to pay the car loan for you. After 5 years or so when the car is unfit to rent, they will give back the car to you. So you get your car after 5 years being used by the Car Rent company at a cheaper price. Its like buy 2nd hand car but using your own name at cheaper price.The case here is the Car Rent company probably nonexistent, they use investors name to buy cars and they don't pay the bank like they promised. The car loan already due to 7month, so the car will be confiscated by the bank later. So investor left with unpaid car loan under their name and doesn't get anything, and the car will be confiscated by the bank. Owner feels cheated and gang up to take back their car that is under their name.
